items.Description:
Magic Mountain is a huge climbing center in Wedding. It has hundreds of sport climbing routes as well as bouldering. http://www.magicmountain.de/ and apparently a gym and sauna!

The cost is based on how many hours you climb for around 4 hours so the entry would be 15EUR (or 12 for students). You can also rent climbing shoes, harnesses and belay devices if you don't have them. I'll be arriving around 4:00pm and I'll wait outside for about 10 minutes. My friend designed some nice Meetup posters so it will be easy to find us if you want to come later.Â 

We'll be mainly doing top-roping with the possibility of a bit of lead climbing if people bring ropes. If you're a beginner and you wouldn't be confidant belaying another climber, could you please post a comment or write me a message. That will help us make sure we have enough experienced climbers to belay everyone.

items.postedTitle: Play easy jazz in the park
items.Description:
Bring your instruments to the park! Singers, horns, guitars, ukuleles, banjos, violins, kazoos... anything goesÂ (we only use a small amp for vocals and some backing tracks ).Â 

We'll play stuff out of the real book, all jazz genres, easy and a bit more advanced, or improvise on easy lead sheets ( simple early swing and gypsy, minor and major blues, turnarounds and so on ). Let's have fun!

You can check out our list of songs in the group discussion forum and add suggestions:
http://www.meetup.com/de/Jazzpicnic-an-experiment-im-volkspark/messages/boards/thread/49080191


Bring along some drinks and a snack, and maybe some nice picnic blankets ;)Â 

We will provide:

- some sheet music and backing tracks, but bring along your own if you have any.
- a mic for vocals
- a music stand
- small percussion, shakers andÂ tambourine

**Â OnlyÂ musiciansÂ should sign up but they can bring friends along of course **

How to find us:

We meet at the entrance of Hasenheide Park opposite Graefestrasse. We continue further inwards to a rectangular space with a bench, surrounded by a low stone wall and trees.Â 

The spot looks like this. If you arrive later, you start from the entrance of the park, just walk 7 minutes up the hill. On the right hand side at a crossroad you will find the space.

Welcome Sunday Socials,

Members of the group and friends meet there to exchange languages and their international experience or just have a good time to meet likeminded poeple!

At the moment we meet in the bar Alberts at Stuttgarter Platz 13.

We get the following offer for Sunday Socials:

Coffee - 1,60Euro
Tea - 1,50Euro
Beer - 2,50Euro

Starting time is 5pm.(Until 8pm)

The event is for FREE.

Adress:
Stuttgarter Platz 13
https://www.google.de/maps/place/Stuttgarter+Pl.+13,+10627+Berlin/@52.5054966,13.3019475,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x47a850dc2e8bbddb:0xd27f1feba7c67575

GrÃ¼Ãe

Andrea

The International Quickstep is the Roaring 20's "happy child" of several earlier dance forms, including the Foxtrot and Charleston, but it quickly evolved into its own style. Its light and fast footwork and upbeat music make it one of the most crowd-pleasing of the 5 International Standard dances to watch. But it's even better to dance it - and as it's seldom taught outside of competitive dance schools, here's your chance to learn it. We'll start from scratch and build on basics.

To get a taste of Quickstep, below is one of the world's top professional ballroom couples, demonstrating a wide range of Quickstep figures (from basic to advanced), to the signature 2/4 timing of Quickstep music:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uf6xj2q1jvw&list=PLcL4Tjb7H5F_Y93nTgfKD4EMhy0O2DdON

We'll teach a handful of the fundamental Quickstep figures, and how to combine them. You'll also learn some technique (from competitive ballroom dance) to make you look good. :)

You can come alone (we'll change partners often) or with a partner, though in the latter case we do ask that both people register on Meetup â an accurate attendee count helps us organize things. Other info:

â¢Â Attendance policy: Like Woody Allen said, 80% of life is just showing up. We have an attendance policy because: 1) we have limited space; 2) a dance class is highly participatory and each person's attendance matters; 3) because we give everyone individual attention; and 4) because theÂ organizers bear financial riskÂ in paying for the studio up-front. Thus,Â if you flake/no-show, or cancel within 24 hours before the event, it will be noted, with a warning. If you no-show twice, you'll be permanently banned from the group. So honor your RSVP, and we can all focus on dancing - instead of wondering who will show up. Thanks.

â¢Â The fee covers the cost of renting the dance room, and this time, is payable at the door.

â¢Â Wear clothes comfortableÂ to move in. Please note: street shoes are NOT allowed on the studio floor, so bringÂ dance shoes, or if you don't have any yet, wear socks you're OK to dance in - your feet will need to slide on the floor.

â¢Â AlsoÂ bring drinks/snacks to keep yourself going and/or to share - it's not a heavy workout, but more than a walk - and a lot more fun.

Please remember: like any other physical activity, you participate at your own risk, and your RSVP is acceptance of that responsibility. Thanks and we look forward to seeing everyone!
